item.title: Diving into Java Bytecode
item.description: Java code is compiled into an intermediate representation called "bytecode". It is this bytecode which gets executed by JVM and is later converted into machine specific instructions by JIT compiler. With this article, we attempt to dive into bytecode and understand the internals of various bytecode operations. Let’s get an understanding of some terms before we start to dive in. Terminology Bytecode An intermediate representation of Java code which JVM understands.
